content.name: Accordion
content.description: A vertically stacked set of interactive headings that each reveal a section of content.
content.refImplementation:
/accordion Is it accessible?
  Yes. It adheres to the WAI-ARIA design pattern.
/accordion Is it styled?
  Yes. It comes with default styles that matches the other components' aesthetic.
/accordion Is it animated?
  Yes. It's animated by default, but you can disable it if you prefer.

subComponents.description: An element that renders when the image hasn't loaded. This means whilst it's loading, or if there was an error. content.name: Card
content.description: Displays a card with header, content, and footer.
content.refImplementation:
/card w-[350px]
    /header
        /title Create project
        /description Deploy your new project in one-click.
    /content
        /form
            /div grid w-full items-center gap-4
                /flex flex-col space-y-1.5
                    /label Name
                    /input Name of your project
                /flex flex-col space-y-1.5
                    /label Framework
                    /select Select
                        /item @value="next" Next.js
                        /item @value="sveltekit" SvelteKit
                        /item @value="astro" Astro
                        /item @value="nuxt" Nuxt.js
    /footer justify-between
        /button %outline Cancel
        /button Deploy

content.name: Carousel
content.description: A carousel with motion and swipe
content.refImplementation:
/carousel %horizontal @align=start @itemsPerSlide=3 mx-0 p-5 gap-3
		/image rounded-lg shadow-md aspect-video object-cover w-full bear
		/image rounded-lg shadow-md aspect-video object-cover w-full tiger
		/image rounded-lg shadow-md aspect-video object-cover w-full hippo
		/image rounded-lg shadow-md aspect-video object-cover w-full koala
		/image rounded-lg shadow-md aspect-video object-cover w-full flamingo
		/image rounded-lg shadow-md aspect-video object-cover w-full ostrich

props.name: active
props.description: Determines if the carousel is active.

props.name: align
props.description: Defines the alignment of the carousel items.

props.name: containScroll
props.description: Specifies how the scroll container should handle snapping behavior.

props.name: direction
props.description: Sets the direction of the carousel, either left-to-right (ltr) or right-to-left (rtl).

props.name: dragFree
props.description: Allows the carousel to be dragged freely without snapping.

props.name: dragThreshold
props.description: Sets the threshold for dragging to the next slide.

props.name: duration
props.description: Specifies the duration of the transition animation.

props.name: inViewThreshold
props.description: Defines the threshold at which a slide is considered in view.

props.name: loop
props.description: Enables looping of the carousel slides.

props.name: skipSnaps
props.description: Skips snapping behavior during drag.

props.name: slidesToScroll
props.description: Sets the number of slides to scroll at a time.

props.name: startIndex
props.description: Defines the initial slide index.

props.name: watchDrag
props.description: Watches for drag events to update the carousel.

props.name: watchResize
props.description: Watches for resize events to update the carousel.

props.name: watchSlides
props.description: Watches for changes in the number of slides to update the carousel.

props.name: opts
props.description: Additional configuration options for the carousel.

props.name: plugins
props.description: An array of plugins to enhance the carousel's functionality.

props.name: orientation
props.description: Defines the orientation of the carousel.

props.name: setApi
props.description: A function to set the Embla carousel API.

props.name: itemsPerSlide
props.description: Specifies the number of items to display per slide. Can be a number or an object for responsive values.

subComponents.name: CarouselContent
subComponents.description: A container for the carousel's content, managing the overflow and positioning of items.

subComponents.name: CarouselItem
subComponents.description: An individual item within the carousel.

subComponents.name: CarouselNext
subComponents.description: A button to scroll to the next slide.

props.name: asChild
props.description: If true, renders the button as a child element, inheriting the props of its parent.

subComponents.name: CarouselPrevious
subComponents.description: A button to scroll to the previous slide.

props.name: asChild
props.description: If true, renders the button as a child element, inheriting the props of its parent.

	/center border border-slate-200 rounded size-32 1
	/center border border-slate-200 rounded size-32 2
	/center border border-slate-200 rounded size-32 3

	/content bg-slate-800
		/center border border-slate-200 rounded size-32 1
		/center border border-slate-200 rounded size-32 2
		/center border border-slate-200 rounded size-32 3
	/previous bg-slate-100 rounded-none

content.name: Command
content.description: Fast, composable, unstyled command menu for React.
content.refImplementation:
/command Type a command or search...
        # Suggestions
            Calendar
            Search Emoji
                /icon smiley
            Calculator
        ---
        # Settings
            Profile <Cmd + P>
                /icon User profile
            Billing <Cmd + B>
                /icon Credit card
            Settings <Space + S + shift>

props.name: label
props.description: Accessible label for this command menu. Not shown visibly.

props.name: shouldFilter
props.description: Turn off the automatic filtering and sorting when set to false.

props.name: filter
props.description: Custom filter function for whether each command menu item matches the search query.

props.name: defaultValue
props.description: Optional default item value when initially rendered.

props.name: value
props.description: Controlled state of the selected command menu item.

props.name: onValueChange
props.description: Event handler called when the selected item of the menu changes.

props.description: Enables looping around when using arrow keys.

props.description: Disables selection via pointer events.

props.name: vimBindings
props.description: Disables ctrl+n/j/p/k shortcuts when set to false.

          /div grid grid-cols-4 items-center gap-4
            /label Name text-right
            /input @defaultValue="Alex McKee" col-span-3
          /div grid grid-cols-4 items-center gap-4
            /label Username text-right
            /input @defaultValue="@McKeeAlex_" col-span-3
      /footer
        /close
          /button @type=submit Save changes

content.name: Drawer
content.description: Shows a drawer popping from the bottom of the screen
content.refImplementation:
/button %outline Open Drawer
	/drawer 
		/header mx-auto w-full max-w-sm
			/title Move Goal
			/description Set your daily activity goal.
		/content p-4 pb-0 mx-auto w-full max-w-sm
			/div flex items-center justify-center gap-2
				/button %outline h-8 w-8 shrink-0 rounded-full @size="icon"
					/icon minus size-4
					/span sr-only Decrease
				/div flex-1 text-center
					/div text-7xl font-bold tracking-tighter 350
					/div text-[0.70rem] uppercase text-muted-foreground Calories/day
				/button %outline h-8 w-8 shrink-0 rounded-full @size=icon
					/icon plus size-4
					/span sr-only Increase
			/div mt-3 h-[120px]
				/chart %bar [10, 20, 30, 45, 90, 120]
    /footer mx-auto w-full max-w-sm
        /button Submit w-full
        /close w-full @asChild
            /button %outline Cancel

props.description: Indicates if the drawer is nested inside another component.

props.description: Sets the background color when the drawer is scaled.

props.description: Specifies the threshold for closing the drawer.

props.description: Timeout for locking scroll when the drawer is open.

props.description: Specifies if the drawer can be dismissed by clicking outside.

props.description: Indicates if the drawer can only be dragged by the handle.

props.description: Index from which the drawer should start fading.

props.description: Current active snap point of the drawer.

props.description: Callback function to set the active snap point.

props.name: fixed
props.description: Determines if the drawer is fixed.

props.name: modal
props.description: Indicates if the drawer should behave as a modal.

props.name: onClose
props.description: Callback function called when the drawer is closed.

props.name: noBodyStyles
props.description: Prevents the drawer from applying default body styles.

props.name: direction
props.description: The direction from which the drawer should appear.

props.name: preventScrollRestoration
props.description: Prevents restoring scroll position when the drawer is closed.

props.name: disablePreventScroll
props.description: Disables the prevention of scroll restoration.

		/center p-6 bg-slate-200 $item.name

/data $movies = mock://A list of movies with title and poster
/grid gap-2
	/foreach $movies
		/center p-6 bg-slate-200 $item.title

content.name: Form
content.description: A control that allows the user to toggle between checked and not checked
content.refImplementation:
/form
	# Email
	[Your email]
	-- This will help us stay in touch. We don't spam!
		
	# Message
	[> Enter any message here...]
	-- Come on! You can write anything!
		
	/div flex gap-4
		<x> Send me important notifications
		<> Send me marketing emails
		
	/div flex flex-col gap-2
		# What do you prefer?
		[] Bacon
		[x] Miso soup
		[] Pizza

	# How old are you?
	() 18 or minus
	() 18-35
	(x) 35 or more

	/submit @asChild
		/button Submit @type=submit

subComponents.name: FormMessage
subComponents.description:
A validation message which is automatically wired (functionality and accessibility) to a given control when nested inside a `Field` part. It can be used for built-in and custom client-side validation, as well as server-side validation. When used outside a `Field` you must pass a `name` prop matching a field.

`Form.Message` accepts a `match` prop which is used to determine when the message should show. It matches the native HTML validity state (`ValidityState` on [MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ValidityState)) which validates against attributes such as `required`, `min`, `max`. The message will show if the given `match` is `true` on the controlâ€™s validity state.

You can also pass a function to `match` to provide custom validation rules.

Read our Composition guide for more details.

props.description: Used to indicate on which condition the message should be visible.

props.name: forceMatch
props.description: Forces the message to be shown. This is useful when using server-side validation.
props.descriptionMdx: Forces the message to be shown. This is useful when using server-side validation.

A field's validity is available automatically when nested inside a `Field` part, otherwise you must pass a `name` prop to associate it.

	/div flex flex-col gap-2
		# What do you prefer?
		[] Bacon
		[x] Miso soup
		[] Pizza
	# How old are you?
	() 18 or minus
	() 18-35
	(x) 35 or more
	/submit @asChild
		/button Submit @type=submit

examples.title: Composable syntax
examples.code:
/form
	/field 
		/label Email
		/control @asChild 
			/input Your email
		/description This will help us stay in touch. We don't spam!
	/field 
		/label Message
		/control @asChild 
			/textarea Enter any message here...
		/description Come on! You can write anything!
	/div flex gap-4
		/field
			/control @asChild 
				/switch Send me important notifications ON
		/field
			/control @asChild 
				/switch Send me marketing emails
	/div flex flex-col gap-2
		/field
			/label What do you prefer?
			/control @asChild
				/checkbox Bacon
		/field
			/control @asChild
				/checkbox Miso soup ON
		/field
			/control @asChild
				/checkbox Pizza
	/field 
		/label How old are you?
		/control @asChild 
			/radio-group @defaultValue="35-or-more"
				/radio 18 or minus
				/radio 18-35
				/radio 35 or more
	/submit @asChild
		/button Submit @type=submit

examples.title: With messages
examples.code:
/form
	/field @name=Email
		/label Email
		/message @match="valueMissing" Please enter your email
		/message @match="typeMismatch" Please provide a valid email
		/control @asChild 
			/input @type=email @required
	/field @name=Question
		/label Question
		/message @match="valueMissing" Please enter a question
		/control @asChild
			/textarea @required
	/submit @asChild 
		/button %default Post question

content.name: Menubar
content.description: A visually persistent menu common in desktop applications that provides quick access to a consistent set of commands
content.refImplementation:
/menubar
	File
		New Tab <Cmd + T>
		New Window <Cmd + N>
		New Incognito Window
		---
		Share
			Email link
			Messages
			Notes
		---
		Print... <Cmd + P>
	Edit
		Undo <Cmd + Z>
		Redo <Shift + Cmd + Z>
		---
		Find
			Search the web
			---
			Find...
			Find Next
			Find Previous
		---
		Cut
		Copy
		Paste
	View
		[x] Always Show Bookmarks Bar
		[ ] Always Show Full URLs
		---
		Reload <Cmd + R>
		Force Reload <Shift + Cmd + R>
		---
		Toggle Fullscreen
		---
		Hide Sidebar
	Profiles
		( ) Andy
		(x) Benoit
		( ) Luis
		---
		Edit...
		---
		Add Profile...

examples.title: Short syntax
examples.code:
/menubar
	File
		New Tab <Cmd + T>
		New Window <Cmd + N>
		New Incognito Window
		---
		Share
			Email link
			Messages
			Notes
		---
		Print... <Cmd + P>
	Edit
		Undo <Cmd + Z>
		Redo <Shift + Cmd + Z>
		---
		Find
			Search the web
			---
			Find...
			Find Next
			Find Previous
		---
		Cut
		Copy
		Paste
	View
		[ ] Always Show Bookmarks Bar
		[ ] Always Show Full URLs
		---
		Reload <Cmd + R>
		Force Reload <Shift + Cmd + R>
		---
		Toggle Fullscreen
		---
		Hide Sidebar
	Profiles
		( ) Andy
		(x) Benoit
		( ) Luis
		---
		Edit...
		---
		Add Profile...

content.name: Page

/button %link @to="about" Open about page
		/page /about About page
				/div grid gap-4
						/h1 font-bold text-3xl 
							About
						/p text-lg text-muted-foreground
							Welcome to the about page.
						/button %outline @to="/" w-fit
							/icon chevron-left
							Go back

	This is the about page contents

content.name: Popover
content.description: Displays rich content in a portal, triggered by the parent button or link

/button Click to open popover
		/popover
			/div grid gap-4
				/div space-y-2
					/h4 font-medium leading-none Dimensions
					/p text-sm text-muted-foreground
						Set the dimensions for the layer.

					/div grid grid-cols-3 items-center gap-4
						/label Width
						/input @defaultValue="100%" col-span-2 h-8
					/div grid grid-cols-3 items-center gap-4
						/label Max. width
						/input @defaultValue="300px" col-span-2 h-8
					/div grid grid-cols-3 items-center gap-4
						/label Height
						/input @defaultValue="25px" col-span-2 h-8
					/div grid grid-cols-3 items-center gap-4
						/label Max. height
						/input @defaultValue="none" col-span-2 h-8

props.name: type
props.description: Describes the nature of scrollbar visibility, similar to how the scrollbar preferences in MacOS control visibility of native scrollbars. `"auto"` means that scrollbars are visible when content is overflowing on the corresponding orientation. `"always"` means that scrollbars are always visible regardless of whether the content is overflowing. `"scroll"` means that scrollbars are visible when the user is scrolling along its corresponding orientation. `"hover"` when the user is scrolling along its corresponding orientation and when the user is hovering over the scroll area.
props.descriptionMdx:
Describes the nature of scrollbar visibility, similar to how the scrollbar preferences in MacOS control visibility of native scrollbars.

"auto" means that scrollbars are visible when content is overflowing on the corresponding orientation.
"always" means that scrollbars are always visible regardless of whether the content is overflowing.
"scroll" means that scrollbars are visible when the user is scrolling along its corresponding orientation.
"hover" when the user is scrolling along its corresponding orientation and when the user is hovering over the scroll area.

props.name: scrollHideDelay
props.description: If `type` is set to either `"scroll"` or{' '} `"hover"`, this prop determines the length of time, in milliseconds, before the scrollbars are hidden after the user stops interacting with scrollbars.

props.description: The positioning mode to use, `item-aligned` is the default and behaves similarly to a native MacOS menu by positioning content relative to the active item. `popper` positions content in the same way as our other primitives, for example `Popover`{' '} or `DropdownMenu`.

props.description: The preferred side of the anchor to render against when open. Will be reversed when collisions occur and `avoidCollisions` is enabled. Only available when `position` is set to{' '} `popper`.
props.descriptionMdx: The preferred side of the anchor to render against when open. Will be reversed when collisions occur and avoidCollisions is enabled. Only available when position is set to{' '} popper.

props.name: avoidCollisions

props.name: collisionBoundary

            /input @id=username @defaultValue="@peduarte"

        /card
          /header Password
          /content
            /label Current password
            /input @id=current @type=password
            /label New password
            /input @id=new @type=password
          /footer
            /button Save password
